name: Hyksos of Ancient Egypt Trivia Game | Ancient History | 5 Questions

questions.text: When did the Hyksos first settle in Northern Egypt?
questions.explanation:
18th Century B.C.

	They settled in Egypt in the 18th century B.C and by the 17th century had conquered Egypt.

questions.text: The Hyksos swept down into Egypt from what area?
questions.explanation:
Asia Minor.

	The Hyksos were of semitic origin and swept down from Asia Minor to conquer Egypt.

questions.text: The Hyksos ruled as kings during the 15th dynasty. Where did they establish their capital?
questions.explanation:
Avaris.

	Avaris is now present day Telled-Dab'a.

questions.text: The Hyksos were able to maintain rule due to their advanced weaponry. Which of the following was not a part of their arsenal?
questions.explanation:
catapults.

	It is suggested that the Hyksos brought these already developed weapons down from Asia Minor.

questions.text: Which Egyptian king, last of the 17th Dynasty, began the military campaign that eventually vanquished the Hyksos from Egypt?
questions.explanation:
Kamose.

	Kamose began the process of expelling the Hyksos from Egypt. His brother Ahmose, first king of the 18th Dynasty, completed the process.
